Author: sateva
Text: Recovery doesn’t mean never having another disordered thought again in your life, but that’s okay. You learn healthy ways to manage them when they do come up, and with time, you have less and less of them and they become so much less powerful. It will go from being the thing that’s ruining & controlling your life to something that affects your life so little it’s truly impossible to imagine when you’re in the worst of it.   The early days of recovery can be so hard, especially when you feel like you’re not getting anywhere. But you’re fighting it now, and that really is the biggest step in all of it. Its such a huge thing, and you should really try to allow yourself to be proud of yourself for that. It’s everything.
